description: The bellflower (Campanula takesimana 'Elizabeth') is a simply stunning perennial flowering plant. It features large, lantern-shaped flowers that dangle from long, graceful stems. White and pink in color, each flower has three overlapping petals that curl outward, creating a beautiful bell-like shape. Once planted, this hardy species will often flower multiple times during the warm season. An added plus: bellflowers are known to attract butterflies and hummingbirds, making them a great addition to any wildlife garden.
